head.title: At Home and Cox Plan Internet TV Test

hedline.hl1: At Home and Cox Plan Internet TV Test

abstract.p: At Home Corp to cooperate with Cox Communications in test of interactive television services in San Diego; intends to deliver interactive services such as news, weather, e-mail and shopping (S)

block.p: Moving from computer screens to television sets, the At Home Corporation will cooperate with Cox Communications in a test of interactive television services in San Diego.

At Home, which is controlled by the AT&T Corporation, is the nation's leading provider of cable modem service, which delivers high-speed Internet access using cable television lines. Cox is one of the biggest cable television providers.
Moving from computer screens to television sets, the At Home Corporation will cooperate with Cox Communications in a test of interactive television services in San Diego.

At Home, which is controlled by the AT&T Corporation, is the nation's leading provider of cable modem service, which delivers high-speed Internet access using cable television lines. Cox is one of the biggest cable television providers.

Cable operators of all sizes have spent billions of dollars in recent years to upgrade their systems to give computer users high-speed access to cyberspace, but many United States households do not have computers at all.

In their San Diego trial, At Home and Cox intend to deliver interactive services, like news, weather, and on-demand stock quotes, as well as e-mail and shopping. One person close to the test, which will be formally announced today, said the effort, which could begin as soon as next month, will cover only a few thousand homes.
